result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin M Thimm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Determination of sentence credit shall be deferred pending compliance with probation.
Consecutive to: 12CF38

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not enter any establishment where the primary purpose of business is the sale or service of alcohol.

Defendant shall have no contact with Reef Point Resort or Dan Knodl.

Defendant shall not be present in any location where there are known drug users or drug dealers, or locations where illegal drugs are used or purchased.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens of his blood, breath, or urine.

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Colloquy w/ counsel: Court is an acquaintance of the victim in this case; Defendant has no objection to proceeding; Partial joint recommendation; free to argue term of probation; Argument from State, Defense; Statements from defendant; Court proceeds to sentencing.
Sentencing hearing at 09-11-2015 10:30 am

Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Resolution reached; joint recommendation.  Counsel requests an adjourned sentencing date for brief argument and to allow Defendant to pay restitution.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and adjourns sentencing.  Recommendation as follows:  withheld sentence; 5 years probation consecutive to 12-CF-38; court costs and DNA; $500 restitution plus 10% surcharge and no contact with Reef Point Resort or the owner.  Counsel free to argue on length of probation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 10:30 am.
At the 8-19-15 Jury status hearing, Court to address State's letter of 7-17-15 requesting an adjournment of the trial.
State's Discovery Demand

Letter received from Atty. Hanson

Jury status hearing at 08-19-2015 08:15 am.
Jury trial at 08-24-2015 08:30 am.

Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Not guilty plea entered.  Two day jury trial requested.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Arraignment at 07-01-2015 02:45 pm
Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Information received and reading waived.  Arraignment continued.  Arraignment scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Arraignment at 05-20-2015 08:15 am

Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed and reading waived.  Arraignment scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Prior: PO Box 31, Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution, Plymouth, WI 53073-0031 United States
Preliminary hearing on April 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant appears via video conference  & by Atty Jack Alan Umpleby.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to be present at today's hearing; Court finds that Defendant waives his right to be present and agrees to appear via video conference.  Defendant is scheduled to be released from KMCI on 3-17-15 and wishes to retain private counsel.  Short recess to allow counsel to speak with Defendant outside the presence of the Court and DA.  Reconvene.  Defendant maintains the position that he wishes to retain new counsel.  Argument by counsel on bond; State requests cash bond.  Court will allow bond to stand as fixed.  Defendant's contact information upon release from prison is as follows:  425 West Rossman Street, Hartford WI  53027; phone number (262) 673-4575.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Letter received from Atty Stephanie Hanson

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant is incarcerated at KMCI and will be released 3-21-15.  $2,500 signature bond set.  Defendant to meet with SPD and information given.  Judge's clerk to notify SPD.  Defendant requests a speedy trial.  Court indicates this demand must follow the filing of an Information.  Hearing scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
